content: @cuviper wanted to kick this off - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80812
I think talking about union with manuallydrop being safe is good, and we can touch on the stabilization in 1.49 of union's with manuallydrop fields
sure, that could use an explanation
slice::fill stabilization seems cool to callout too
not sure what else
it's a slow release, especially knowing const-generics are coming next...
yeah - I think just those two things are a good start, not sure I see much else too notable.
Intra doc links got about 1000x faster if that counts :)
(deleted)
(deleted)
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79682
I don't think it's noticeable for most and we rarely touch on performance
@Joshua Nelson You should tag those with relnotes-perf, in the future and I’ll include them in the Internal Only section in the relnotes.
I think the most interesting thing in the release notes is the Option<File> being the same size as File, and think it could expanded on by explaining what is a niche and why it matters.
yeah, it's sort of niche (heh)
but seems like something we could touch on

There's also "ops::{Index, IndexMut} are now implemented for fixed sized arrays of any length." that I just included, because it was in the previous relnotes but didn't land until this release. So could be a nice "const generics coming soon™️".
Yeah, there's still a small chance we don't see const generics hit stable in 1.51 if something comes up last minute; I wouldn't mention a specific release. But noting that impl seems good.
Well that's why said soon™️ and not "next release". :stuck_out_tongue:
@cuviper wanted to check-in that you're feeling good about the topic list proposed in the discussion/thoughts above
yeah, seems fine to me
@cuviper I may have missed it, but did you get a chance to open the blog PR yet?
@simulacrum I shared this in the meeting: https://hackmd.io/@cuviper/ryZO_tDyO
but I haven't had time to do more since then
I'll try to get to that today
looks pretty good at quick skim, can leave more detailed feedback later - I think doing so on a PR makes sense.
thanks!
https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/771
if there's any more feedback, please let me know soon so I can adjust it tonight
otherwise, the PR should be open to maintainer pushes, so feel free to tweak it at the last minute
you guys are often running the release before I'm even awake... :zzz:
@cuviper left one comment - https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/771#pullrequestreview-588219859
but we can likely resolve it tomorrow if you don't get to it
thanks for getting it into shape :)
